info.title: Challonge API v2.1 documentation
info.description: Before sending API requests, you'll need to authorize your Swagger session by clicking the Authorize button above.

scopes.application:organizer: Full access to the user's resources that are associated with your application
scopes.application:player: Read the user's resources that are associated with your application, register them for tournaments, and report their scores
scopes.tournaments:read: Read all of the user's tournaments
scopes.tournaments:write: Create, update and delete any of the user's tournaments
scopes.matches:read: Read matches associated with the user's tournaments
scopes.matches:write: Update matches associated with the user's tournaments
scopes.attachments:read: Read match attachments associated with the user's tournaments
scopes.attachments:write: Create, update and delete match attachments associated with the user's tournaments
scopes.participants:read: Read participants associated with the user's tournaments
scopes.participants:write: Create, update and delete participants associated with the user's tournaments
scopes.communities:manage: Read and manage communities that the user belongs to

parameters.name: Authorization-Type
parameters.description: Default value for `Authorization-Type` header. If you want to use APIv2's oAuth2 authentication method, use, change this to `v2`

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used as caching key for future response

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of collection members per page

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Tournament Type (when group stage is enabled, this is for the final stage)

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Tournaments created after the date given. Format should be (mm/dd/yyyy)

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Tournaments created before the date given. Format should be (mm/dd/yyyy)

get.description: Returns the user logged in via oAuth, or the API key owner for v1 authentication.

parameters.name: Authorization-Type
parameters.description: Default value for `Authorization-Type` header. If you want to use APIv2's oAuth2 authentication method, use, change this to `v2`

get.description: Returns administered communities by the user.

description.default: There's a fine line between the Method actor and the schizophrenic.
Is the President going to pardon me?

group_id.default: (If this is a group stage match, there will be a group id here.)

username.default: (The participant's associated Challonge username, if present.)

misc.default: Store whatever string you like here

private.description: When true, this tournament will be opted out for search engine bots and will be hidden from indexes on Challonge

starts_at.description: The scheduled start time. Note that Challonge will not automatically start the tournament.

consolation_matches_target_rank.description: For single or double elimination only, consolation matches will be run to break ties up to this final placement.

accept_attachments.description: Whether or not to allow match attachment uploads

open_signup.description: Allow registered Challonge users to self-register for this tournament

signup_cap.description: Maximum number of participants allowed in the tournament before the waitlist kicks in

check_in_duration.description: Number of minutes for check-in prior to tournament start time. Must be a multiple of 5.

sequential_pairings.description: When true, seeding rules are ignored and participants are placed in the bracket from top to bottom.

auto_assign.description: Automatically assign stations to playable matches (requires one or more stations)

only_start_matches_with_assigned_station.description: When true, playable matches won't start until they have a station assigned to them

group_stage_enabled.description: When true, Challonge's two-stage format is used (group stage + final stage). Additional tournament state transitions must be performed (start_group_stage, finalize_group_stage).

rr_iterations.description: Round robin format only, where 1 = single round robin, 2 = double round robin, 3 = triple round robin

ranked_by.description: Round robin format only, determines the primary ranking stat.

rr_pts_for_match_win.description: For 'custom' ranked by round robin group stage

rr_pts_for_match_tie.description: For 'custom' ranked by round robin group stage

rr_pts_for_game_win.description: For 'custom' ranked by round robin group stage

rr_pts_for_game_tie.description: For 'custom' ranked by round robin group stage

split_participants.description: Double elimination only - starts the bottom half of seeds in the losers bracket
Double elimination only - starts the bottom half of seeds in the losers bracket

grand_finals_modifier.description: When blank, the losers bracket winner has to beat the winners bracket winner twice.

description.default: Everyone should go to Nerdfest. Thank you.

tie.description: To mark the match complete as a tie, set this to true and ensure 'advancing' is false for reported scores.

winner_id.description: The participant ID of the winner

score_set.description: Comma-separated scores for this participant_id. E.g. if participant ID 76 won 4-1, 2-4, 4-0, the value should be '4,2,4' (the other player's value should be '1,4,0'). This format may seem odd, but it scales to support 3+ participants per match in Free For All.
